Sharp as Saladin’s legendary blade, the sleek, classically curved Cold Steel® Scimitar® places the power of the sword in your pocket.
Our craftsmen have captured the timeless quality of superior cutlery and united it with the finest in modern materials. The result is a dazzling, high impact folding linerlock® like no other knife available.
The Scimitar® blade is hollow ground stainless steel, honed to razor sharpness and features the famous curve of its ancient namesake. Painstakingly designed to facilitate the draw cut, the most effective cutting stroke known to man, the blade also features a needle sharp point which pierces at the slightest touch.

Superior engineering combines traditional appeal with the latest Western technology in the contoured Zytel® and steel frame handle designed exclusively by Lynn Thompson for the Cold Steel® Scimitar.® The pistol grip handle facilitates all types of forward grips, including the saber, quarter saber and hammer grips. Its sleek curves, finger grooves and checkering settle naturally and securely into the hand, maximizing the user’s ability to control both the edge and the point. Reverse or palm reinforced grips are mastered with ease, making the pistol grip shape of the Cold Steel® Scimitar® handle one of the most versatile and user-friendly ever devised. A hard-hitting ball shaped pommel contributes to the Scimitar’s® rock steady grip and versatility. The pommel can be used as a striking tool to deliver less than lethal blows to nerve centers and soft targets. It can also serve as a secondary grasping point, allowing the user to extend his reach by as much as three inches.

Lock strength is critical in a high performance knife, and the Scimitar® is head and shoulders above the rest. We have equipped the Scimitar® with a state-of-the-art titanium linerlock® for maximum strength and durability. The strength of titanium is peerless in the cutlery industry, and tests on this mechanism resulted in it holding 100 pounds without collapsing, far exceeding the load-bearing ability of our competitors.

A pocket clip makes it a snap to carry and access quick as a flash. Feel the extraordinary power of history’s most famous sword design in a folding knife of unequaled versatility- and put it in your pocket - with Cold Steel's Scimitar®.

title: For Sale:  -SOLD- Browning (Belgium) Auto 5 (A5) Light Twelve
location: South of Farmville, Greenville, North Carolina
postcontent:
1965 26" Vent Rib, single bead, Cyl Bore (3-star=***), 12 ga. 2-3/4" Belgium-made Browning A5 Light twelve, in very good condition.
Has some finish wear, a few nicks a dings on stock, and some sort of odd "dimpling" on the receiver, but otherwise in fine condition for its age. 
There's also a small wear mark on the bottom of the barrel, but it's not too noticeable, and doesn't show up at all in the photos. It looks like the blueing may have been touched up in that spot at some point in the past, but I can't say for sure.
Bore is like a mirror.
All 'defects' are as expected from years of hunting in the field.
This would make a fine hunting gun for upland game or really anything that flies, crawls, runs or hops!

Price fairly firm, partial trades considered, but I mostly need cash, since I'm selling this for an older friend who doesn't have internet access.
The gun belonged to his father who died in (I think) 1991, so the gun hasn't been shot in quite a while. I'll be happy to test fire it for you or you can shoot it yourself when you come to check it out.

More photos available upon request, for serious buyers only.
My time is valuable (as is yours), so please don't waste it.

postcontent:
America Remembers Gun

Museum of The Confederacy Tribute - sold new for $2795.00

UNFIRED in original shipping crates with fitted wooden display case.
see here for details:

http://www.americaremembers.com/products/MCTRE/MCTRE.asp

A Tribute Honoring and Remembering The Confederate Cause And Those Who Fought So Valiantly For The Cause

The LeMat revolver was a truly unique firearm design, and is closely associated with the Confederacy, since it was first utilized by soldiers who fought for the Confederate States of America. The Museum of the Confederacy Tribute Revolver combines the classic design of the fabled LeMat revolver with striking 24-karat gold and nickel artwork honoring the legacy of the Confederate soldiers and their leaders who valiantly fought for the cause of the Confederacy.
This is America Remembers' first-ever issue on a LeMat revolver which we are issuing with the approval and authorization of The Museum of the Confederacy.

Bore: is in outstanding condition. An easy 8-9 out of 10.

Sights: 
Rear: Earliest style flip up ladder sight(One just like mine, but in far worse condition just sold on eBay for $182.49 for the sight alone!) 
Front: Blade bead with ivory bead insert

Wood: Forend is in good condition overall. Stock has some shrinkage and someone put a recoil pad on it before I got it.

Metal: overall the metal is in really good shape with no real pitting or major handling marks aside from:
The saddle ring stud broke off. This is an easy fix. $18 in parts and $20 in labor.
The upper tang has a very old repair on it. This does not affect the function at all. 

Overall this is a beauty of an old Winchester levergun and an addition to anyone's collection.

I can text or email pictures to anyone who is interested.

postcontent:
For sale is a Yugoslavian Model 57 Tokarev in 7.62x25mm. I would estimate it to be ~90% condition finish due to some minor cosmetic blemishes (e.g. scratch where the add-on thumb safety used to go). Functionally it is 100%. The only thing missing is the add-on thumb safety. Imported by PW Arms - I am the first US owner of this fine shooting handgun.

Includes the following:
-Yugo M57 Tokarev 7.62x25mm military surplus pistol (C&R eligible), shiny bore
-1 original military surplus M57 magazine (100% reliable)
-3 US-made M57 magazines (not 100% reliable in my experience)
-9mm drop-in conversion barrel
-Tokarev compensator (replaces stock barrel bushing, usable in either 7.62x25mm or 9mm)
-140 rounds of Yugoslavian FMJ surplus Tokarev pistol ammo (brass cased, corrosive primed)
-100 rounds of PPU FMJ brass-cased, non-corrosive commercial ammo
-used blue Beretta plastic pistol case

Basically, for what you would pay for a cosmoline-covered surplus M57 shipped to your door (if you have a C&R license like I do) you get all the extras, ability to shoot 9mm, and 240 rounds of Tokarev ammo (the Yugo FMJ is nearly impossible to find now).

title: Want To Buy:  FFL for transfers
postcontent:
I am a collector looking for an FFL to do out of state transfers for me as I like to buy online fairly often. I usually deal with Newington Gun Exchange but they're a bit far for me, and I've lately used Riverview Sales which is a bit closer but I'm sick of dealing with the owner's grouchy and constantly-bothered demeanor.

They both charge $40, and combined with the fuel costs of getting to NGE or dealing with Dave's horrible attitude at Riverview, it's just not worth it at all.

I've heard of a place called Anthony's Collectibles in Windsor Locks, and supposedly he only charges $15. He would be an incredible asset since I work right off 75 in Suffield, but he's still on his military deployment and there's no hint of when he'll be back.

I'm looking for someone who ideally is closer/cheaper/not a jerk. You'll get plenty of references and continued business from me as I'm constantly looking for new toys and have several friends who like to shop online too.

Thanks!

title: For Sale:  Colt 6940 M4 AR-15 with EoTech XPS2-0 Holographic
postcontent:
Together for $1800, or I'll sell the rifle/sight separately as well. Rifle: $1450 EoTech Sight: $400 

This is the Colt 6940 Law Enforcement Carbine. It's marked Restricted for Law Enforcement/Military use only, as Colt was contracted to make them before the ban was lifted. Fairly rare as you can't buy this version anymore; it's also one of the best out of the box AR's ever produced. Check out the reviews online! 

It has the one-piece monolithic upper, collapsible stock, and folding sights. The stock grip was changed out for an Ergo Grip rubberized one. 

The rifle is in basically perfect condition save for a toolmark on the flash hider. A new one costs about ten dollars; you just screw it on the end of the barrel. I didn't replace it because it's only cosmetic and you can hardly notice it anyway. No scratches or dings on the rifle anywhere, and no wear on the rails to speak of either. 

The rifle has around 1000 rounds or so through it. 

It'll come with two mags as well; the Colt factory mag, and the magnificent Magpul P-Mag. Both hold 30 rounds. 

It also has the EoTech XPS2-0 holographic sight for it (with standard cirle and dot reticle), which is basically brand new. A new one costs around $500. 

You're welcome to make me an offer; keep in mind my asking price for both the M4 and the EoTech is less than the original cost of the rifle alone.

title: For Sale/Trade:  FN Herstal TSR-XP Sniper Rifle with scope and upgrades
location: Rowan County, North Carolina, United States
postcontent:
Up for sale or trade is a FN Herstal TSR-XP. This rifle is chambered in 223. The stock is an olive drab green hogue stock that is pillar bedded. It also has a 20 inch fluted heavy barrel. The twist rate is 1:9. The muzzle was professionally threaded 1/2x28. Also installed is a YHM compensator/qd suppressor mount. An oversized tactical bolt knob has also been installed. The factory trigger seems to have a really awesome pull but I have not fired it. This rifle has never been fired at all. It has been moved around a bit and does have a few handling marks but nothing more. The rifle has a 20moa picatinny top mount rail. The scope is a 16x42 SWFA Super Sniper Scope that hasn't been zeroed in. The scope also has a sun shade and butler creek flip caps. The scope rings are UTG quick detach rings. 


FN guarantees these rifles to shoot 1 moa. This rifle should easily shoot sub moa if the shooter does his or her part. I originally purchased this rifle to hunt coyotes on my farm. After scouting my land for a few nights, I realize that most of my targets are going to be in brushy areas because this is where they roost. 


Retail Costs: 

FN TSR-XP Rifle in 223: $1000

UTG Rings: $40

Barrel Threading: $100

Scope Sun Shade: $55

Butler Creek Flip Caps: $15

Total: $1655

I am now asking $1100 or best offer cash and $1400 in trade. I have dropped my asking price by $200 for a quick sale. I am negotiable in terms of the price. I will also consider full or partial trades. Please be reasonable with your offers. This rifle has had quite a bit of work done to it. If you are looking for the ultimate sniper set-up then this is for you. If you are looking for a coyote rifle for use in stands or even from a bench, then this is the perfect rifle for you. I will consider shipping the rifle at the buyer's expense. Thanks for looking.

postcontent:
Chiappa Revolver Rhino    	Defense revolver, offers great concealability thanks to a very unusualprofile. The flat cylinder grants maximum comfort. The Chiappa Rhino barrelis aligned with the bottom most chamber which is the key component toRhino's tame characteristics. The position of the barrel lowers the centerof gravity and yields a centerline of the bore more in line with theshooter's arm allowing for the most natural "point ability" while engaginga target. This characteristic also drastically reduces both recoil andmuzzle flip which insures subsequent shots to be on target faster than everbefore. The reduction of the recoil allows for the use of ultra lightalloys to be used in the construction of the Rhino minimizing any adverseeffect. The flat sided cylinder design of the Rhino reduces the typicalrevolver profile allowing greater concealment. Featuring both double andsingle action characteristics, the single action is actuated by a hammercocking device that engages the unexposed hammer to prepare to fire. LNIB: WALTHER PPS (POLICE PISTOL SLIM) 9MM 2 MAGS CASE AND ALL MANUALS $525 OBO EMAIL OR CALL TXT REDACTED MUST SHOW VALID DL AND CARRY PERMIT TO BUY OR TRADE.


Walther PPS is short recoil operated, locked breech pistol that uses modified Browning type locking with tilting barrel. Frame of the gun is made from impact resistant polymer. Trigger is of double action only type, striker fired, with pre-cocked striker system, similar to QA system used in Walther P99 pistols. This system requires a manual recocking (by partial slide retraction) in the case of misfire. Gun is fitted with automated trigger safety and firing pin block; additional "storage type" safety is provided by removable backstrap of the grip; once backstrap is removed, the firing pin is automatically decocked and gun is blocked until the backstrap is reinstalled. This patented system is called QuickSafe by Walther. Sights

title: For Sale:  Tasco Pro Class 4X Handgun/Scout Scope
location: Greeley or Windsor, Fort Collins, Colorado
postcontent:
It's in new condition with box, instructions, scope covers and does not look like it was ever mounted. It has the larger 30mm tube and a unique tapered crosshair with a small dot in the center for a reticule. It is one brand of only two I am aware of that has the adjustable parallax feature on a handgun/scout scope. I find the AO especially applicable for its use on rim fires. The distances encountered vary from 10 to 100 yards or more and at the closer ranges the parallax in non-AO handgun scopes is too great for precision shooting. It also has some nice target turrets that allow quick changes for near to far distance shooting. The lowest setting on the AO is at 25 yards but it turns below that and seems to provide a very clear image down below 10 yards. This would make it ideal for use on a high quality pellet pistol for basement shooting. On the box it gives model #P4X30. It was made in Japan some years ago where it seems more premium optics come from. My price of $165 is firm as I should be trying harder to find a use for it vs. passing it on.  Will ship for $10 extra. 

I do not respond to ANY emails so please email your phone number and I will contact you with mine. Sorry but this procedure eliminates most of the tire kickers and all of the spammers.

Thanks

Felix Sarasqueta 410 SXS  Send for Photos.

A SUPER NICE FELIX SARASQUETA SXS .410 NICELY ENGRAGVED WITH PHEASANTS AND DUCKS ON CASE COLORED RECEIVER, DOUBLE TRIGGERS, AUTOMATIC SAFETY. CASE COLORS NEAR 99%. BARRELS ARE 26" BLUED. WITH SOLID RIB.SINGLE BRASS BEAD AND EXTRACTORS. WOOD IS PISTOL GRIP -- NICE WALNUT,WITH CHECKERED FOREARM AND STOCK. PLASTIC BUTTPLATE AND GRIP CAP WITH WHITE OUTLINE. THIS HIGH QUALITY DOUBLE WAS IMPORTED BY FIE/FLORIDA BARREL IS MARKED: MADE IN SPAIN BY FLIX SARASQUETA, Y CIA.

Terry Weiland calls them (Sarasqueta) the gunmaker to the kings in his book Spanish Best

MADE IN SPAIN BY FELIX SARASQUETA Y CIA

There are 3 Sarasqueta names, Victor, Felix, and JJ
Victor Sarasqueta was one of the dominant Spanish gunmakers until it went out of business in the early 80's. During its heyday, Sarasqueta and AyA were the two biggest companies.

As a result there were other members of the Sarasqueta family that made guns attempting to cash in on the family name. Felix is the most common although there was a J.J. Sarasqueta and subsequently a company called the "Sons and Widow of J.J. Sarasqueta.
